entry.title: The Howl of Drowning Depths
entry.summary:
Author: am0rawr

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,346Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: The darkness of a ship‚Äôs hold is not an absence of light ‚Äî it is a substance. Thick, viscous, like black oil seeping through rotting planks and settling into lungs and bones. Derek Hale lies chained in that darkness, his body weakened by wolfsbane, his senses flayed raw by the relentless presence of the sea ‚Äî an element forbidden to werewolves, invasive and maddening. The hunters who captured him bring a new prize aboard. Something pale and wrong.Something with rubies set into its eyes and a cold that reeks of the abyss. They call it a trophy.They call it a thing. For Derek, it becomes a reason to survive. In a filthy cell, between injections of poison and the distorted roar of the ocean pressing in from all sides, a desperate pact is forged between a land-bound alpha and a creature born of the depths. A fragile, wordless alliance shaped by pain, proximity, and the shared instinct to endure. Because the true danger is not the captivity.It is not the hunters. It is what they begin to become when survival demands trust.And it is the impossible secret the ocean has dragged to the surface ‚Äî wrapped in rags, breathing softly, and destined to change everything.

If he and Scott never went out that fateful night and looked for that body, or if he and Derek never became friends, or hell, if he never agreed to Deatons plan in the first place‚Ä¶ then none of this would be happening. Author: Nightowl_22

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,372Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Perhaps even abused his power as a father‚Äîand as an alpha werewolf, no less. After all, it wasn't normal for dads to touch and be curious about their son's penis and their similarities. entry.title: All Around Me I Heard You Pass
entry.summary:
Author: sockpuppetstrings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,681Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 30

Summary: Beyond the Boundary lies the Great Forest, where the gods of Beacon Hills reside. Derek‚Äîthe dark mark on the Hale house‚Äîis the small time deity Stiles‚Äô mother has chosen as her patron. But on the dreadful day of her death, the Nemeton is severed‚Äîa burgeoning god meant to join the Hale Pantheon. Someone local is to blame and Peter retaliates by descending on the village with a terrible decree: the town must sacrifice one of its own for the next eight years. It's a mysterious affair. Someone is simply chosen in spring and disappears at Year‚Äôs End, never to be heard from again. On the eighth year of this rite, Stiles and Lydia turn eighteen, which automatically makes them candidates for the sacrificial pool. The name that survives Peter‚Äôs holy fire will change the course of both their lives. *** I have watched you grow. I have seen you stumble and rise. I have been charmed by your humor, your inquisitive nature, the radiance of your soul. You are not just a shade to me. You are joy. Stubbornness and defiance and unwavering love spun you into being. And I see all of these things brimming inside you. Do not doubt that I love you.
